Comments_Questions: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study
How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework
How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented
How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course
How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom
How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic
If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
How useful was this course in preparing you for production work
How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material
Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
Comments_List: I think the course title/description is misleading.
I really like Jon's teaching style it might be my favorite of all my courses so far.

I think the amount was great, except when a level of background knowledge was assumed that not all members of the class had. I totally understand that the idea was that classmates/fellow group members support those folks, but that didnt always happen.

the group projects with other members in the class was tough. trying to meet with stage managers who are always in rehearsal and have no interest in finding time to meet or the topics at hand made the lesson less valuable for me. I would have gotten more out of the project if I could sit on my own and go through the budget process myself. I found that I spent more time worrying about the complications of having to meet with someone and basically do their portion of the project for them meant that I had less time and motivation to learn from the assignment myself
I think it was frustrating to have Jon state he was answering questions as the designer for the budgeting assignment; no one in my group felt confident answering many technical questions that arose.

I was frustrated by the scenic focus of the class - I think from the amount of discussion surrounding the other departments, the class as a whole wouldve been interested in diving deeper into other departments, whether its because its all new to them or that as TDs the focus on scenery was old hat.
